hours_text:
Visit Us:

The Marblehead Museum’s Properties are located in Marblehead’s historic district. More than 200 privately owned colonial period homes and buildings preserve the unique qualities of this New England fishing port and harbor.

[Hours and locations](/hours)

admission_text:
OPEN JUNE 1-OCTOBER 31, TUESDAY-SATURDAY

We are asking visitors to pre-purchase your admission tickets for a scheduled tour of the Jeremiah Lee Mansion.

45-minute tours are available Tuesday - Saturday, on the hour starting at 10am. The last tour leaves at 3pm.

Admission:

$10 per adult

Free for Museum members, NARM, MTA, for families with EBT, WIC, ConnectorCare cards, active-duty military and their families, and children under 14.

Please call 781-631-1768 with any issues or concerns. Thank you!

[**Click Here to Book online now!**](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/marbleheadmuseum/items/349258/?full-items=yes&flow=667971&u=62490652-f468-4094-8c0d-e8129d0857ad&from-ssl=yes&back=https://marbleheadmuseum.org/tickets/%3Ffl_builder)

### J.O.J. Frost Gallery

[](https://marbleheadmuseum.org/joj-frost/)

CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC IN JANUARY AND FEBRUARY A permanent gallery dedicated to J.O.J. Frost's artwork and sculpture,

### Jeremiah Lee Mansion

[](https://marbleheadmuseum.org/properties/lee-mansion/)

The 1768 Lee Mansion is a magnificent Georgian home built by American craftsmen for Jeremiah Lee, the wealthiest merchant in Colonial Massachusetts.

### Civil War Museum

[](https://marbleheadmuseum.org/civil-war-museum/)
